facts: Coffee is the world’s second largest traded commodity.  Crude oil is first.
Hawaii is the only American state that grows coffee

Legend has it that Coffee was discovered by a goat herder in Ethiopia in the 1500s.  He saw his goats eating coffee cherries. Afterwards, he observed a change in their behavior. They gained a high amount of energy and they didn’t sleep at night.
Coffee was banned in Mecca in 1511. It was believed to stimulate radical thinking and idleness.
Coffee stays warm twenty percent longer when you add cream.
Coffee beans grow on a bush. They are actually the pit of a berry, which makes them a fruit.
Beethoven was such an ardent coffee lover that he would count sixty beans per cup before making his brew.
An American spends on average one thousand and ninety two dollars a year on coffee. That’s around $20 a week.
Brazil is the lead exporting country of coffee.
According to International Coffee Association, Europe imports more coffee than the USA.
The “Big Four” coffee roasting companies Kraft, P&G, Sara Lee and Nestle buy about fifty percent of the coffee produced worldwide.
Coffee beans are actually cherry seeds

According to the USDA Brewed coffee has more caffeine than espresso per serving. There’s only sixty four milligrams of caffeine in one serving of espresso vs ninety five milligrams of caffeine in one eight ounce serving of brewed coffee.
New York City has the most coffee shops in the U S  per capita
According to a study from early 2018, two quality beverages coffee and wine could elongate your life.

Global warming is taking its toll on the coffee industry. According to a study from 2017, the area of land suitable for coffee production could be reduced by up to 88 percent if precautions aren’t taken to preserve the crop.
